item.title: Michele add a quote by Gerald Gould
item.description:
"Beyond the East the sunrise, beyond the West the sea, And East and West the wanderlust that will not let me be; It works in me like madness, dear, to bid me say good-by! For the seas call and the stars call, and oh, the call of the sky!
I know not where the white road runs, nor what the blue hills are, But man can have the sun for friend, and for his guide a star; And there's no end of voyaging when once the voice is heard, For the river calls and the road calls, and oh, the call of a bird!
Yonder the long horizon lies, and there by night and day The old ships draw to home again, the young ships sail away; And come I may, but go I must, and if men ask you why, You may put the blame on the stars and the sun and the white road and the sky!" -- Gerald Gould

item.title: Michele add a quote by Christopher Buehlman
item.description: "But when I make a good [taxidermy] mount I feel like I beat God in a small way. As though the Almighty said, Let such critter be dead, and I said, 'Fuck You, he can still play the banjo." -- Christopher Buehlman

item.title: Michele add a quote by Marguerite Henry
item.description: "Why not dream your own wonderful sequels? When you have finished a book, it can go on in your mind, the characters doing just what you want them to do." -- Marguerite Henry

item.title: Michele add a quote by Jonathan Schooler
item.description: "Just because an idea is true doesn't mean it can be proved. And just because an idea can be proved doesn't mean it's true. When the experiments are done, we still have to choose what to believe." -- Jonathan Schooler

item.title: Michele add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Live a good life. If there are gods and they are just, then they will not care how devout you have been, but will welcome you based on the virtues you have lived by. If there are gods, but unjust, then you should not want to worship them. If there are no gods, then you will be gone, but will have lived a noble life that will live on in the memories of your loved ones." -- Anonymous

item.title: Michele add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "All human troubles derive from our inability to sit still and alone in a room." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Michele add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life, when all that we need to make us happy is something to be enthusiastic about." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Michele add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "You can't be a real country unless you have a beer and an airline - it helps if you have some kind of football team, or some nuclear weapons, but in the very least you need a beer." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Michele add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"The Seven Deadly Sins:
Wealth without work, Pleasure without conscience, Knowledge without character, Commerce without morality, Science without humanity, Worship without sacrifice, Politics without principle." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michele add a quote by William Beebe
item.description: "The beauty and genius of a work of art may be reconceived, though its first material expression be destroyed; a vanished harmony may yet again inspire the composer, but when the last individual of a race of living things breathes no more, another heaven and another earth must pass before such a one can be again." -- William Beebe

item.title: Michele add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Michele add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michele add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Michele add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Michele add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Michele add a quote by J. Lincoln Fenn
item.description: "Some people have children. I have books. Much more interesting and they never ask me for money." -- J. Lincoln Fenn
